explains: n. 寄宿，借宿；租住的房间
wordGroup: board and lodging 膳宿；供应食宿

sentences.en: While taller wheat competed better for sunlight, they had a tendency to collapse under the weight of extra grain—a trait called lodging.
sentences.cn: 虽然较高的小麦能更好地争夺阳光，但它们在额外谷粒的重压下会有倒塌的倾向——这种特性被称为倒伏。

sentences.en: Recent reports found that lodging with a student of a different race may decrease prejudice and compel students to engage in more ethnically diverse friendships.
sentences.cn: 最近的报告发现，寄宿于不同种族的学生可能会减少偏见，并迫使学生建立更多不同种族的友谊。
